body:
Testing:

- [x] IntelliJ 2019.3 mac (@devoncarew)
- [x] AS 3.6 mac (@stevemessick)
- [x] AS 3.5 windows (@kenzieschmoll)
- [x] AS 3.5 linux (@terrylucas)

## CLs to hot fix:

- [x] Fix inspector bug
https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/commit/9e3804af5190042ce5b4ddbce38ff2bf3f9fad92
- [x] Safe styling polish:
https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/commit/2baa680bedebf5d77e563028dcd9ef83d9558407

- [x] https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/commit/7c6c34229bdc894a2a0bf73581474229b2cc0dab Don't enable the screen mirror unless it will work.

- [x] https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/commit/faf5fcdbfc6883f90e5037bfe9a271198602fc32 Remove checkbox.

- [x] Fix logic bug deciding when screen mirror is available.
https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/commit/64dcb9c6319eef83457bd14f48b0c0505a0cafcf

As of 1:35pm PST December 4, everything on master should be hotfixed. (done, 2:05pm, updated 3:05))

comment_data.body:
We see transient errors and warnings when working with add-to-app modules. When the Flutter module is first added to an Android app an error is generated because Gradle does not recognize the module. That issue gets fixed and the error is no longer applicable, but the balloon still looks scary.

When the project is re-opened with a Fluter file open in the editor we see a banner claiming Dart support is not enabled. The banner disappears within a few seconds, after our Gradle sync listener fires. We should work with @alexander-doroshko to find a way to prevent the banner from being displayed.

These issues are minor and should not delay the M42 release.

I spend a lot of time re-positioning tool window sizes after I create a new project (the project window, the right-hand side windows, the Run window, ...). Not feedback for this release specifically, but something we may want to improve in the future.
Jump to source / Jump to type source in the inspector doesn't work for flutter web (at least for package:material widgets; it may be generally true)
We may be missing the 'inspect' button from the Inspector:
We're not getting any memory usage info:
The Inspector issue and the memory one are release blockers; Jacob is going to look at the Inspector and I'l look at the memory issue.

I don't know if this is a general issue, but in 2019.3, when launching the plugin from source (not the release candidate), I see the IDE lock up when I open the Performance tool window (IntelliJ spins forever servicing events from the EDT but doesn't make any progress - I just see a spinning 'busy' wheel in the runtime workbench). This could be an issue specific to my machine or install.
I am seeing memory usage appear now (in the release candidate), so suspect that there's a race condition in starting the memory profiler. I'll open an issue, but I don't think it's a release blocker.

> The Inspector issue and the memory one are release blockers; Jacob is going to look at the Inspector and I'l look at the memory issue.

https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/pull/4168 <- fix for the inspector issue.

> Jump to source / Jump to type source in the inspector doesn't work for flutter web (at least for package:material widgets; it may be generally true)

Can you file bugs for these two? This is likely a long standing issue.
The jump to source is  likely a file path format issue. The jump to type source is likely an unimplemented VM Service api on Flutter Web.

TEST: Verify that a run configuration (<Project Name>.dart) is enabled in the run/debug selector.

Creating a module doesn't have configuration when the module is created from 

File > New > New Flutter Project 
select module

If I close my existing project and create Flutter Project from the startup dialog then the configuration is created.

[Windows - AS 3.5] "Verify that the new editor includes a sample creation banner." There is no sample creation banner for TextField nor AppBar.

edit: the issue shows up (no banner) on windows, but not on mac; likely path related

edit edit: turns out that we were initially testing against `flutter stable`, where the samples aren't (yet) expected to show up. more testing found that this wasn't an issue (but we have a followup PR for some cleanup - not necessary to land for this release).
@kenzieschmoll That's a bug in the test script. Samples were removed. Thanks for checking :)
Talked to @devoncarew offline and he said samples should still show up for a few of the widgets, TextField and AppBar being two of them. He was able to see them on his Mac.

[Windows - AS 3.5] For flutter module project, "Verify that a run configuration (<Project Name>.dart) is enabled in the run/debug selector."  There is not a run configuration titled <Project Name>.dart - just main.dart. I don't know if this is an error in the testing script or a bug.

Project Open Verification

create a new Flutter project and delete IntelliJ metadata:
flutter create foo_bar
cd foo_bar
rm -rf .idea
rm foo_bar.iml
open project ("File > Open")
verify that the project has the Flutter module type (the device pull-down displays) and analyzes cleanly

This all works but I'm unable to launch app to the emulator error:

```
Launching lib/main.dart on AOSP on IA Emulator in debug mode...
Running Gradle task 'assembleDebug'...
âœ“ Built build/app/outputs/apk/debug/app-debug.apk.
Installing build/app/outputs/apk/app.apk...
Error: ADB exited with exit code 1
Performing Streamed Install

adb: failed to install /usr/local/google/home/terry/M42_projects/foo_bar/build/app/outputs/apk/app.apk: Failure [INSTALL_FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_STORAGE]
Error launching application on AOSP on IA Emulator.
```

Killed emulator and cold start same problem.

> adb: failed to install /usr/local/google/home/terry/M42_projects/foo_bar/build/app/outputs/apk/app.apk: Failure [INSTALL_FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_STORAGE]
> Error launching application on AOSP on IA Emulator.
> ```
> 
> Killed emulator and cold start same problem.

You might want to re-test with a real android device, just to eliminate any possible emulator issues in your setup?

@terrylucas When I've seen INSTALL_FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_STORAGE in the past it indicated I had too many apps installed on the emulator. Cleaning up all the various Flutter test apps solved the problem for me.

@stevemessick Yep cold restart of emulator / wipe data usually works for me too - but didn't this time.  Eventually, it just started magically working.  And works with a real device too (couldn't test real device until in work instead of chromoting to Linux box).
@kenzieschmoll The run config should be named main.dart.
[Windows 3.5 AS] "hit the Flutter Hot Restart button (or hit the Debug button again, or cmd-shift-s / ctrl-shift-s)" - ctrl-shift-s keybinding does not perform hot restart

> [Windows 3.5 AS] "hit the Flutter Hot Restart button (or hit the Debug button again, or cmd-shift-s / ctrl-shift-s)" - ctrl-shift-s keybinding does not perform hot restart

We refactored the keybindings recently - we should update the testing script. We should likely reference the keybinding for 'save all' (on a mac, that's just cmd-s).

[Windows AS 3.5] - Add to app support - placing flutter module outside of Android app directory causes Gradle project sync failure.

The script instructions state: "Put it in the Android app directory once and put it outside the app another time."

![image (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43759233/70191739-9b122680-16ae-11ea-8ce3-62b6ddfb11b3.png)

Add to App works for both Kotlin and Java.

Nit: Import to select is 'io.flutter.embedding.android' not io.flutter.embedGradle

Kotlin debugging and attaching worked exactly as described Run > Flutter Attach menu enabled and shown.  Plus could debug code (Kotlin and Dart).

Java worked fine too.

BTW, I used latest 3.5.2 fresh install.
Thanks to everyone for help with testing!

title: M42 release testing feedback
